thread.title: Columbus residents brave the cold temps
thread.title_full: Columbus residents brave the cold temps

author: myfox28columbus.com
title: Columbus residents brave the cold temps
text: {p}It’s that time of year again, time to shake the dust off winter gear.{/p}{p}Wednesday night into Thursday morning, many woke up to bone-chilling weather this morning.{/p}{p}“Not my time to shine. My time to endure and enjoy, though,” said shopper Lorrie Dean.{/p}{p}Despite the cold temperatures, Lorrie Dean bundled up from head to toe out doing some shopping.{/p}{p}{sd-embed data-embed-type=\"video\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}WSYX is{a href=\"https://abc6onyourside.com/news/local/columbus-ohio-weather-forecast-winter-fall-cold-december-b -high-temps-stay-mid-20s-thursday\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://abc6onyourside.com/news/local/columbus-ohio-weather-forecast-winter-fall-cold-december-b -high-temps-stay-mid-20s-thursday\"} forecasting slick spots and very cold days {/a}with sunshine. A few light snow showers Thursday night, then slowly warming up heading into the weekend, with rain returning by Sunday.{/p}{p}“It’s cold, so I got my mittens. I like the cold as long as the sun is out to soften it,” said Dean.{/p}{p}If you were to travel to Goodale Park, you would see ice forming at the pond.{/p}{p}Some people are eager for colder weather.{/p}{p}“I personally like the cold; this is my season. I think I feel great,” said resident Megan Holland.{/p}{p}Winter doesn’t officially start until next Saturday.
